pageContext.description: A fragment of a cast copper alloy socketed axehead, dating from the Late Bronze Age (c. 1150-800 BC).  The fragment consists of a small portion of its lower body and blade.  Type undeterminable. Only the lower half of the body and the blade survive; the surface is very worn. The object has a dark greenish/grey patina it is smooth and plain. There are no obvious resharpening marks or signs of wear on the surface of the blade, but the blade has a curved shape with blunt edges. The broken edge indicates where the axe was hollow. The axe measures 22.9mm long, 24mm wide, 7.5mm thick and it weighs 10.6 grams. The thickness of the wall at the point of break is 2.5mm.
